11-d-02-08-88-RFP.Narrative: THE CREW WHILE HANDLING LIGHT CONSIST OF ENGINES, 141, 122 AND 138 IN A SOUTHWARD DIRECTION FAILED TO ACKNOWLEDGE STOP/PROCEED INDICATOR IN "STOP" POSITION, RESULTING IN THE CONSIST ENTERING THE 3 "A"CROSSOVER WHICH WAS LINED AGAINST THEIR ROUTE. IN ENTERING THE CROSSOVER, WHICH WAS FOULED BY CONRAIL TRAIN O1PY (40 CARS) BEING OPERATED ON THE SOUTHBOUND FREIGHT RUNNING TRACK, WITH RESULTS LEAD ENGINE IN CONSIST 141 COLLIDED WITH CARS TILX 100075 (DAMAGE $6,000) AND UTLX 1629 (DAMAGE $22,000) 31ST AND 30TH CARS IN CONRAIL TRAIN. HEAVY DAMAGE WAS INCURRED TO ENGINE 141 AND CARS INVOLVED. NO PERSONAL INJURIES OR DAMAGE TO TRACK. NONE OF THE EQUIPMENT INVOLVED DERAILED.
